title: Bicycle playing cards
content:
Greetings! I'm a total newbie to the font world and I was wondering   
if you pro's could help me out. Does anyone know where I could find a   
font like what's used on Bicycle playing cards? Thank you for your   
time, I really appreciate it!   
   
Here's a few links for visual aids:   
   
 [http://www.usplayingcard.com/images/corebicycle.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310071635/http:/www.usplayingcard.com/images/corebicycle.jpg)   
   
 [http://www.usplayingcard.com/media/tradition/uspc-thumb/11.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310071635/http:/www.usplayingcard.com/media/tradition/uspc-thumb/11.gif)
author: anonymous

comments.content:
Two possibilities here, both freebies, that might get you "close enough" to fool the casual observer or provide something that can be modified without too much trouble:   
   
Campanile (PC Postscript only) by Dieter Steffmann   
 [http://www.steffmann.de/english/fonts1.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310071635/http:/www.steffmann.de/english/fonts1.htm)   
   
Ringlet Black by George White. I contacted Mr White over the weekend because his Web pages were not accessible. He wrote back that the server was renamed as per below. I can't reach this new URL either and he's aware of the problem and contacting the Duke sysadmin.   
 [http://bibliofile.duhs.duke.edu/gww/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310071635/http:/bibliofile.duhs.duke.edu/gww/)   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310071635im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/7387.gif)   
   
Campanile and Ringlet (Normal, which is thinner that Black) are reportedly included in "24 Victorian Display Fonts" by Dan X. Solo. Amazon has it. I was going to include a link, but those Amazon URLs are so long it'd wrap 2 or 3 times.   
   
.

on the swoopy-ball-terminal-thingy note, davida is cool. or at least interesting. not as close as above though.   
   
 [http://www.philsfonts.com/detail.html?sku=LI35311871P1](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310071635/http:/www.philsfonts.com/detail.html?sku=LI35311871P1)

If all you want is something in a similar style but free, you may find something you like over at [Nick's Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310071635/http:/www.nicksfonts.com/). He has a bunch of Deco-era kinds of faces for free, and they look pretty well-made.

Thanks for all the replies, I really appreciate it!   
   
In my travels I found a few that were somewhat close, but not free, unfortunately.   
   
 [http://www.identifont.com/link?39Z+3RL+205324](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310071635/http:/www.identifont.com/link?39Z%2B3RL%2B205324)   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bergsland/diaconia-old-style/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310071635/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bergsland/diaconia-old-style/)   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/kuenstler-165/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310071635/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/kuenstler-165/)   
   
Thanks again!

Welcome to the Type-ID Board, werks99!   
   
We already had a [type-ID thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310071635/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/4446.html) on those, but couldn't find the actual "Bicycle" font. Let's hear if anybody else has ideas.
